resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

jonkeane commented on a change in pull request #11485:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11485#discussion_r732835875



##########
File path: r/R/dataset-write.R
##########
@@ -22,11 +22,9 @@
 #' make it much faster to read and query.
 #'
 #' @param dataset [Dataset], [RecordBatch], [Table], `arrow_dplyr_query`, or
-#' `data.frame`. If an `arrow_dplyr_query` or `grouped_df`,
-#' `schema` and `partitioning` will be taken from the result of any `select()`
-#' and `group_by()` operations done on the dataset. `filter()` queries will be
-#' applied to restrict written rows.
-#' Note that `select()`-ed columns may not be renamed.
+#' `data.frame`. If an `arrow_dplyr_query`, the query will be evaluated and
+#' the result will be written, so you can `select()`, `filter()`, `mutate()`,
+#' etc. to transform the data.

Review comment:
       ```suggestion
   #' the result will be written. This means that you can `select()`, `filter()`, `mutate()`,
   #' etc. to transform the data before it is written if you need to.
   ```




--

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Current version of the documentation for R function write_dataset, under the dataset parameter, says that:

#' Note that `select()`-ed columns may not be renamed.

Based on response on Q to user list here, my understanding is that this note is a relic and should be removed.

[https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r10b9a97d6c7d6715e6eef5832c61838654586b28f7c31c8fb0ada21d%40%3Cuser.arrow.apache.org%3E]
fields.summary: [R][Doc] Remove relic note in write_dataset that columns cannot be renamed
